title: MicroStrategy raises convertible notes offering to $700M amid stock rally
description:
The firm previously announced a $600 million convertible raise on March 4.

Corporate Bitcoin (BTC) investor MicroStrategy is seeking to sell $700 million, up from $600 million announced just days prior, in convertible notes amid an ongoing cryptocurrency bull market.

According to details disclosed on March 6, the 2030 MicroStrategy convertible notes will bear an interest rate of 0.625% per annum with a conversion price of $1,497.68 per share, representing a premium of 21% compared to its current trading price of $1,234.48 at the time of publication. 

"Holders of notes may require MicroStrategy to repurchase their notes on September 15, 2028, or upon the occurrence of certain events that constitute a fundamental change under the indenture governing the notes at a repurchase price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the notes to be repurchased, plus any accrued and unpaid interest," the firm said.

Read more

title: EU to Implement “Cyber Shield” Legislation to Safeguard Critical Infrastructure
description: In a significant stride towards bolstering cybersecurity, the European Union (EU) is set to enact the Cyber Solidarity Act, a legislative framework aimed at erecting a formidable “cyber shield” to safeguard critical infrastructure and sectors from cyber threats. title: Biden-related meme coin surges 4,700% amid Super Tuesday results
description: The meme coin market reacted with growth after Super Tuesday in the United States, which saw Joe Biden and Donald Trump named presidential candidates.

title: BRC-20 Token Looks Set to Fly High: Is Bitcoin’s New ATH the Reason?
description:

Although the analyst did not share the reason behind his prediction, it seemed that Bitcoin’s (BTC) recent milestone was […]
